intro: Anemia caffrorum, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Anemia caffrorum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant floral display.
